Package com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight

Class RayHandler

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.RayHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Disposable
public class RayHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
Handler that manages everything related to lights updating and rendering

Implements Disposable

  • Field Details

    • isDiffuse

      public static boolean isDiffuse
      if this is public why we have a setter? TODO: remove public modifier and add getter

    • diffuseBlendFunc

      public final BlendFunc diffuseBlendFunc
      Blend function for lights rendering with both shadows and diffusion

      Default: (GL20.GL_DST_COLOR, GL20.GL_ZERO)

    • shadowBlendFunc

      public final BlendFunc shadowBlendFunc
      Blend function for lights rendering with shadows but without diffusion

      Default: (GL20.GL_ONE, GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA)

    • simpleBlendFunc

      public final BlendFunc simpleBlendFunc
      Blend function for lights rendering without shadows and diffusion

      Default: (GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL20.GL_ONE)

  • Constructor Details

    • RayHandler

      public RayHandler​(World world)
      Class constructor specifying the physics world from where collision geometry is taken.

      NOTE: FBO size is 1/4 * screen size and used by default.

      Default setting are:

      • culling = true
      • shadows = true
      • diffuse = false
      • blur = true
      • blurNum = 1
      • ambientLight = 0f
      See Also:
      RayHandler(World, int, int)

    • RayHandler

      public RayHandler​(World world, int fboWidth, int fboHeight)
      Class constructor specifying the physics world from where collision geometry is taken, and size of FBO used for intermediate rendering.
      See Also:
      RayHandler(World)

  • Method Details

    • resizeFBO

      public void resizeFBO​(int fboWidth, int fboHeight)
      Resize the FBO used for intermediate rendering.

    • setCombinedMatrix

      public void setCombinedMatrix​(OrthographicCamera camera)
      Sets combined matrix basing on camera position, rotation and zoom

      Same as calling: setCombinedMatrix( camera.combined, camera.position.x, camera.position.y, camera.viewportWidth * camera.zoom, camera.viewportHeight * camera.zoom );

      See Also:
      setCombinedMatrix(Matrix4, float, float, float, float)

    • setCombinedMatrix

      @Deprecated public void setCombinedMatrix​(Matrix4 combined)
      Deprecated.
      use setCombinedMatrix(OrthographicCamera) or setCombinedMatrix(Matrix4, float, float, float, float) instead
      Sets combined camera matrix.

      Matrix must be set to work in box2d coordinates, it will be copied and used for culling and rendering. Remember to update it if camera changes. This will work with rotated cameras.

      NOTE: Matrix4 is assumed to be orthogonal for culling and directional lights.

      Parameters:
      combined - matrix that include projection and translation matrices

    • setCombinedMatrix

      public void setCombinedMatrix​(Matrix4 combined, float x, float y, float viewPortWidth, float viewPortHeight)
      Sets combined camera matrix.

      Matrix must be set to work in box2d coordinates, it will be copied and used for culling and rendering. Remember to update it if camera changes. This will work with rotated cameras.

      Parameters:
      combined - matrix that include projection and translation matrices
      x - combined matrix position
      y - combined matrix position
      viewPortWidth - NOTE!! use actual size, remember to multiple with zoom value if pulled from OrthoCamera
      viewPortHeight - NOTE!! use actual size, remember to multiple with zoom value if pulled from OrthoCamera
      See Also:
      setCombinedMatrix(OrthographicCamera)

    • updateAndRender

      public void updateAndRender()
      Updates and renders all active lights.

      NOTE! Remember to set combined matrix before this method.

      Don't call this inside of any begin/end statements. Call this method after you have rendered background but before UI. Box2d bodies can be rendered before or after depending how you want the x-ray lights to interact with them.

      See Also:
      update(), render()

    • update

      public void update()
      Manual update method for all active lights.

      Use this if you have less physics steps than rendering steps.

      See Also:
      updateAndRender(), render()

    • render

      public void render()
      Manual rendering method for all lights.

      NOTE! Remember to set combined matrix and update lights before using this method manually.

      Don't call this inside of any begin/end statements. Call this method after you have rendered background but before UI. Box2d bodies can be rendered before or after depending how you want the x-ray lights to interact with them.

      See Also:
      updateAndRender(), update(), setCombinedMatrix(Matrix4), setCombinedMatrix(Matrix4, float, float, float, float)

    • updateLightShader

      protected void updateLightShader()
      Called before light rendering start Override this if you are using custom light shader

    • updateLightShaderPerLight

      protected void updateLightShaderPerLight​(Light light)
      Called for custom light shader before each light is rendered Override this if you are using custom light shader

    • pointAtLight

      public boolean pointAtLight​(float x, float y)
      Checks whether the given point is inside of any light volume
      Returns:
      true if point is inside of any light volume

    • pointAtShadow

      public boolean pointAtShadow​(float x, float y)
      Checks whether the given point is outside of all light volumes
      Returns:
      true if point is NOT inside of any light volume

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes all this rayHandler lights and resources
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface Disposable

    • removeAll

      public void removeAll()
      Removes and disposes both all active and disabled lights

    • setLightShader

      public void setLightShader​(ShaderProgram customLightShader)
      Set custom light shader, null to reset to default Changes will take effect next time #render() is called

    • setCulling

      public void setCulling​(boolean culling)
      Enables/disables culling.

      This save CPU and GPU time when the world is bigger than the screen.

      Default = true

    • setBlur

      public void setBlur​(boolean blur)
      Enables/disables Gaussian blur.

      This make lights much more softer and realistic look but cost some precious shader time. With default FBO size on android cost around 1ms.

      Default = true

      See Also:
      setBlurNum(int)

    • setBlurNum

      public void setBlurNum​(int blurNum)
      Sets number of Gaussian blur passes.

      Blurring can be pretty heavy weight operation, 1-3 should be safe. Setting this to 0 is the same as disabling it.

      Default = 1

      See Also:
      setBlur(boolean)

    • setShadows

      public void setShadows​(boolean shadows)
      Enables/disables shadows

    • setAmbientLight

      public void setAmbientLight​(float ambientLight)
      Sets ambient light brightness. Specifies shadows brightness.

      Default = 0

      Parameters:
      ambientLight - shadows brightness value, clamped to [0f; 1f]
      See Also:
      setAmbientLight(Color), setAmbientLight(float, float, float, float)

    • setAmbientLight

      public void setAmbientLight​(float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Sets ambient light color. Specifies how shadows colored and their brightness.

      Default = Color(0, 0, 0, 0)

      Parameters:
      r - shadows color red component
      g - shadows color green component
      b - shadows color blue component
      a - shadows brightness component
      See Also:
      setAmbientLight(float), setAmbientLight(Color)

    • setAmbientLight

      public void setAmbientLight​(Color ambientLightColor)
      Sets ambient light color. Specifies how shadows colored and their brightness.

      Default = Color(0, 0, 0, 0)

      Parameters:
      ambientLightColor - color whose RGB components specify the shadows coloring and alpha specify shadows brightness
      See Also:
      setAmbientLight(float), setAmbientLight(float, float, float, float)

    • setWorld

      public void setWorld​(World world)
      Sets physics world to work with for this rayHandler

    • getGammaCorrection

      public static boolean getGammaCorrection()
      Returns:
      if gamma correction is enabled or not

    • setGammaCorrection

      public static void setGammaCorrection​(boolean gammaCorrectionWanted)
      Enables/disables gamma correction.

      This need to be done before creating instance of rayHandler.

      NOTE: To match the visuals with gamma uncorrected lights the light distance parameters is modified implicitly.

    • useDiffuseLight

      public static void useDiffuseLight​(boolean useDiffuse)
      Enables/disables usage of diffuse algorithm.

      If set to true lights are blended using the diffuse shader. This is more realistic model than normally used as it preserve colors but might look bit darker and also it might improve performance slightly.

    • useCustomViewport

      public void useCustomViewport​(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Sets rendering to custom viewport with specified position and size

      Note: you will be responsible for update of viewport via this method in case of any changes (on resize)

    • useDefaultViewport

      public void useDefaultViewport()
      Sets rendering to default viewport

      0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight()

    • setLightMapRendering

      public void setLightMapRendering​(boolean isAutomatic)
      Enables/disables lightMap automatic rendering.

      If set to false user needs to use the getLightMapTexture() and render that or use it as a light map when rendering. Example shader for spriteBatch is given. This is faster way to do if there is not that much overdrawing or if just couple object need light/shadows.

      Default = true

    • getLightMapTexture

      public Texture getLightMapTexture()
      Expert functionality
      Returns:
      Texture that contain lightmap texture that can be used as light texture in your shaders

    • getLightMapBuffer

      public FrameBuffer getLightMapBuffer()
      Expert functionality, no support given
      Returns:
      FrameBuffer that contains lightMap
